snippet: In a weak job market, many college graduates are taking unpaid internships that fail to deliver on their promises of experience by offering little more than menial work.
abstract: Many college students, facing the worst job market in decades, are turning to unpaid internships to try and get a foot in an employer's door; internships have proliferated in a number of industries that did not previously offer them; many interns complain that they are being used to do menial labor without pay, raising questions about whether their positions violate federal rules.
lead_paragraph: In a weak job market, many college graduates are taking unpaid internships that fail to deliver on their promises of experience by offering little more than menial work.

headline.seo: Jobs Few, College Graduates Flock to Unpaid Internships
headline.main: Jobs Few, Grads Flock to Unpaid Internships
headline.print_headline: Jobs Few, Grads Flock to Unpaid Internships
